frameDefinitions: A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
An Agent acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular State_of_affairs holds.
An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.
An Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid Capture  or contact with a Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power.
frameExamples: Mo <t>dodged</t>  the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
Jordan <t>feigned</t> a love of jazz music to get her phone number .
The hand <t>around</t> the sword-hilt was no less impressive than the sword .
Therefore, as I passed the school, I <t>hid</t> the gun and holster in the mailbox
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Dodger</fen> acts to avoid an oncoming <fen>Bad_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Bad_entity</fen> is  the oncoming entity to avoid.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the dodging occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the dodging occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
This is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object: Pat <t>falsified</t> <fex name='Original'>the papers</fex>.
The Copy produced by the Creator most commonly occurs as the External Argument of a predicative use of an adjective or noun target: <fex name='Copy'>The painting</fex> is a <t>fake</t>.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is a an event, a state, or a property that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants others to believe have occurred or hold.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The place in which the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is the entity located with respect to the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> is the area that the <fen>Figure</fen> surrounds.
The area or zone immediately external to the <fen>Ground</fen>.  This role excludes <fen>Figure</fen> and is only used in particular constructions such as the following:
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Figure</fen> is located around the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is the entity which is blocked from view.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
The location in which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
<fen>Time</fen> denotes the interval of time during which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become hidden from perceptual access.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.
The <fen>Evader</fen> moves under its own power to <fen>Capture</fen> or contact with the <fen>Pursuer</fen>. Normally the <fen>Evader</fen> frame element is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Pursuer</fen> is going after the <fen>Evader</fen> unless they act.
An actual or hypothetical  event in which the <fen>Pursuer</fen> takes physical control of the <fen>Evader</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the Evading occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Mo</fex> dodged the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
Mo dodged <fex> the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust</fex>.
<fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.
A year after <fex>Audrey Seiler</fex> faked her own kidnapping while at college in Wisconsin, her lawyer says she's getting help and paying restitution.
A college student who staged <fex>her own disappearance</fex> last month will try to reach a plea agreement and avoid trial on charges she obstructed officers.
He had <fex>both hands</fex> wrapped around her arm .

Michael Jackson gave wine to the 13-year-old cancer patient at the center of
the molestation charges he's battling but concealed <fex>it</fex> inside a Coke can.
<fex>The deputy</fex> concealed the bayonet under his coat.
He had concealed the necklace <fex>behind him</fex>.
<fex>The mouse</fex> eluded the cats for only a few minutes.
The mouse eluded <fex>the cats</fex> for only a few minutes.
Rýmirez-Sýnchez , tried in absentia , had evaded <fex>capture</fex> since the murders in Paris on June 27 , 1975
Smithers got away <fex>at the stroke of midnight</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: two and a half years later
